results.title: Evolution and the origin of life
results.brief_description: Uses cinemicroscopy, time-lapse photography, special effects, animation, macro-photography, and documentary and nature footage to survey the history of the earth from its beginning. Topics represented include DNA, bacteria photosynthesis, flagellates, sexual reproduction, multicellular colonies, the Miller-Urey ‘hot soup’ experiment, and Darwin’s theories.

results.title: Evolution
results.brief_description: A sly, funny “survey” of evolution from the earth’s beginnings till now. Sophisticated enough to entrance adult audiences, this film’s rollicking, outrageous humour will delight children. An intriguing discussion starter for biology and social studies courses. Finalist, American Film Festival 1981: Humour & Satire.

results.title: Evolution
results.brief_description: An animated film telling the story of how life came into being on this planet. The animator, Michael Mills, describes the process in this film - from the time when a single-celled amoebae romped about the ocean depths until the first amphibious creatures crawled onto land, eventually to become the progenitor of homo sapiens himself. (Winner of eleven awards.)

results.title: Evolution
results.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Daniel Goldberg, Joe Medjuck, Columbia Pictures and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Seann William Scott and Julianne Moore star in this Sci-Fi comedy about a team of unlikely heroes trying to save the world from an alien invasion. Wayne Green, a wannabe fireman is practising for his fireman’s test when a meteor crashes into his car. He calls in the police who, in turn, call in college professor Ira Kane and his friend, geologist Harry Block. Together, they discover the meteor was carrying single-celled organisms which were evolving at a fast rate. When strange creatures appear in the area surrounding the meteor and start attacking the government is called in to investigate. When the trio discovers the government’s plan to destroy the aliens will actually cause them to reproduce faster, Ira, Harry and Wayne - with the assistance of Government scientist Allison Reed, attempt to save the day. Directed by Ivan Reitman, “Evolution” borrows jokes from his film “Ghostbusters” as well as from the hit film “Men in Black”. Cast also includes Dan Aykroyd in a cameo role as the Governor of Arizona.

results.title: Evita [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Robert Stigwood, Dirty Hands and Cinergi Pictres
results.brief_description: In her award winning role, pop icon Madonna shines as Eva Peron, legendary wife of Argentinian President Juan Peron. Her desperate ambition to climb to the top saw her trade her only assets for one shot at power and fame. Co-starring Antonio Banderas and Jonathan Price, this is the epic true story of the charismatic yet controversial, devoted yet ruthless, deprived yet triumphant Evita. Screenplay by Alan Parker and Oliver Stone and music by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice.

results.title: Evil under the sun
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne, Titan Film Productions and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Peter Ustinov stars as Agatha Christie’s famed Belgian detective Hercule Poirot in this all-star production of ‘Evil under the sun’. Diana Rigg is bitchy Broadway musical star Arlena Marshall, on holiday with her husband and stepdaughter on an Adriatic island. The hotel is filled with people who have a reason to hate her and when she is found strangled on a beach, Poirot must exercise “his little grey cells” and find the murderer. Excellent costuming, a witty screenplay by Anthony Schaffer and a delightful Cole Porter soundtrack will delight.

results.title: Evil angels
results.brief_description: No body. No motive. No weapon. The facts in the Australian murder trial of Lindy and Michael Chamberlain didn’t add up. But strangely, other things did. Things like bigotry against the couple’s religion. Scattershot forensic evidence was accepted as fact. And a nationwide hysteria that was the 1980s equivalent of the Salem witchhunt. Much of “Evil Angels” has the bizarre ring of the tabloid headlines. The wholesale abandonment of reason and justice seems too preposterous to be possible in a free and modern country. Believe it. It’s documented in John Bryson’s book “Evil Angels”. Stars Meryl Streep and Sam Neill.

results.title: Evidence for the Ice Age
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains how anomalous geological formations such as moraines and erratics, polished and straited rocks, resulting from glacial action, show that much of the temperate area has been under ice sheets. For schools.

results.title: Evidence
results.creator_credit: Igor Vamos, Steve Kurtz, Claire Pentecost and Critical Art Ensemble
results.brief_description: Video evidence of the FBI raid of Professor Steve Kurtz’s home which led to his being charged with bio terrorism. The video has a voice over relating the history of events, and shows the aftermath of the FBI raids. This video was created specifically for the exhibition PROOF held in the ACMI screen gallery December 2004.
